title: How to Fill in Your 7 Kindle Keywords: 2024 UPDATE!

tactics.name: Keyword Density Optimization
tactics.description: Filling keyword boxes with multiple words to index more phrases, though this may lower initial rankings.
steps: Input multiple relevant keywords per box
Use combinations of words for broader indexing
caveats: Adding more words may reduce initial rankings for specific phrases
source_quotes: Amazon takes all the combinations of the words in the box and indexes you for them

tactics.name: Target High-Value Keywords
tactics.description: Prioritize specific, descriptive phrases with high search volume and low competition for top rankings.
steps: Use Publisher Rocket to identify phrases with good monthly searches and competitive status
Fill remaining boxes with related terms and category keywords
source_quotes: if you have a specific phrase... you will initially rank better for that phrase

tactics.name: Category Keyword Optimization
tactics.description: Ensure category placement by using category-specific keywords to avoid Amazon's automatic categorization.
steps: Use Publisher Rocket's category feature for keyword suggestions
Use filler keywords if category keywords are insufficient
source_quotes: Amazon really will remove you... use certain keywords to ensure you stay in it

heuristics.name: Review-Driven Boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize boosting keyword relevance
source_quotes: if you rank number one for a keyword you can expect that 27% of the people who type in that keyword will click on your book

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize boosting visibility
source_quotes: if you don't have publisher rocket... you're going to have to kind of take a guess

claims.statement: Amazon uses Kindle keywords to determine book categories and rankings.
source_quotes: Amazon uses the keywords in your seven Kindle keyword boxes to decide if you should be in that category

claims.statement: Amazon automatically re-categorizes books based on keyword usage.
source_quotes: Amazon really will remove you from the categories you choose

niche_patterns.description: Targets specific audience segments with unique constraints for higher specificity.
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Narrower niches often have lower competition and higher conversion rates.
source_quotes: Amazon won't rank you for a madeup word or word they don't think is a searchable phrase
